IBM IOT - Node RED application does not communicate with ESP8266 Node MCU device, through MQTT.

Hi, I am working on IOT project and stumbled upon an issue. In my project, I am referring to the below documentation

https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/IoT/applications/mqtt.html#mqtt

https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/IoT/devices/mqtt.html#mqtt

I have registered a device successfully on the IBM IOT using MQTT. The device is subscribing to the topic iot-2/cmd/on/fmt/txt for commands. There are no errors while registering the device and I am getting a message that the device is "Connected" on "IBM Watson IOT Platform" console. My first question is
column9:
how will we know that the above topic is indeed created? Is it displayed somewhere on the console?

In the second phase
column10: I have created a small application with MQTT Node RED
column11: which should be publishing commands for the device on to the topic iot-2/cmd/on/fmt/txt. This process does not happen. I keep getting an error message that "The topic does not match the authorized rule". I tried to change the name of the topic to iot-2/type/*******/id/********/cmd/******/fmt/******* (as per https://console.bluemix.net/docs/services/IoT/applications/mqtt.html#mqtt). However
column12: I keep getting the same error. Can you please let me know the valid topic format
column13:
when an application publishes commands on topic (for a device)?

A generic question: I found that when the application publishes the command for a device
column14: the format of the topic should be iot- /type/device_type/id/device_id/cmd/command_id/fmt/format_string AND When a device subscribes to the same command
column15: the format of the topic should be iot-2/cmd/command_id/fmt/format_string. Isn't there seem to be a disconnect? When I compare it with Kafka or JMS messaging
column16: we subscribe to the "same topic name" to which we publish
column18:
the topic names for publishing and subscribing seem to be different. Why?

"
